Key Match Events: Mohamed Salah scored the first goal after blocking his initial shot, and Mahmoud Trezeguet scored the second goal with a low cross.
Rami Rabia provided a brilliant assist for Egypt's second goal in the 29th minute.
Mohamed Salah scored his third goal in the 56th minute, making it 3-0, following a howler from the Botswanan keeper.
Ibrahim Adel assisted Mostafa Fathi for Egypt's fourth goal in the 89th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Egypt had won their opening game 3-0 against Cape Verde.
Botswana lost their first game against Mauritania and arrived just hours before the match.
Hossam Hassan had to heavily change his lineup due to injuries and absences of several key players.
Post-Match Reflections: Egypt now tops the group with six points from two games.
The Pharaohs will continue their campaign in October 2024 with home and away games against Mauritania.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Osama Faisal came in for Mostafa Mohamed.
Cleopatra FCâ€™s Khaled Sobhi was handed his debut to play in defense.
Mohamed Elneny also hit his 100th cap in this match.
